newsitem.title: GERMANY: German July industry output up 0.2 percent.
newsitem.headline: German July industry output up 0.2 percent.

text.p: German industrial output rose 0.2 percent in July from the previous month, slowing from 0.7 percent growth in June, the economics ministry said on Tuesday.
Output was down 1.6 percent from July 1995, compared with a 0.8 percent year-on-year decline in June, according to Reuters calculations based on Bundesbank statistics.
The ministry said that summer holidays make the data volatile in short-term comparison.
The consumer goods sector saw the biggest retreat, with output declining 3.9 percent. A 4.2 percent rebound in the construction sector was not enough to make up the difference.

Output in west Germany rose 0.5 percent from the previous month but was down 1.7 percent from the year-earlier month, while east German output declined 5.5 percent from June and rose 3.7 percent from July 1995.
